alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon; Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; John Day Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 12:53PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph will cause blowing and drifting of snow. * WHERE...Grande Ronde Valley, John Day Basin, Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon and Central Oregon. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon; Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; John Day Basin
